p.k: In The Bag Cara hires safecracker Sam to get back her confiscated jewels. But when she insists on joining him on the job, Sam could be making the biggest
A Man With A Fortune A rich and lonely American ventures to England in search of his long-lost family. But when he meets Jane and her flatmate Eva, things begin to go wrong

n.u: Eric Clapton: The South Bank Show Originals

p.n: Eric Clapton: The South Bank Show Originals IV (1)
p.k: 72% Melvyn Bragg looks back to 1987 and 2007 when he met singer-songwriter Eric Clapton to discuss his music and influences
A look at some of the most valuable and iconic pieces to recently be sold at the world's greatest auction houses. A painting by Francesco Guardi goes under the hammer
This intriguing look at the life and art of Raphael explores the High Renaissance master's quest for beauty, reflected most notably in his work Portrait of a Young Woman
Peter Wright's production of Marius Petipa's classic romantic ballet is a tale of betrayal, the supernatural and love that transcends death. From London's Royal Opera House
In The Bag Cara hires safecracker Sam to get back her confiscated jewels. But when she insists on joining him on the job, Sam could be making the biggest
A Man With A Fortune A rich and lonely American ventures to England in search of his long-lost family. But when he meets Jane and her flatmate Eva, things begin to go wrong
A look into the life and career of the four-time Grammy Award-winning rock singer, who gained popularity with songs like We Belong and Hit Me With Your Best Shot

n.u: ZZ Top: Video Killed The Radio Star

p.n: ZZ Top: Video Killed The Radio Star VI (6)
p.k: Directors and musicians reveal the ideas and inspirations that helped create ZZ Top's most memorable music videos
An eye-opening look at the life and films of American film legend Gregory Peck, the Academy Award-winning star of the 1962 drama To Kill a Mockingbird
An intriguing profile of Tunisian-born Italian film actress Claudia Cardinale, who appeared in some of the most acclaimed European films of the 1960s and 1970s
Who's Got The Lady? When a piece of art is stolen, the gallery owner gets his girlfriend to make copies of it to sell. But did the work ever really leave the building?
The Skeleton Key A woman discovers a nasty side to her husband's personality when he goes into hospital before a holiday

n.u: River Phoenix: Too Young To Die

p.n: River Phoenix: Too Young To Die I (6)
p.k: A look at the life of Stand By Me actor River Phoenix, who died outside LA nightclub The Viper Room due to a drug overdose in 1993, aged just 23

n.u: Zaha Hadid: The South Bank Show Originals

p.n: Zaha Hadid: The South Bank Show Originals IV (2)
p.k: Melvyn Bragg looks back on his eye-opening 2007 meeting with the world-renowned Iraqi-British architect Zaha Hadid
A painting from Monet's watercolour series fetches an impressive price at Sotheby's. Elsewhere in London, rare pieces by French glassmaker Rene Lalique
A look into the unique sound of rock band Primal Scream, formed by Bobby Gillespie and Jim Beattie in the 80s

n.u: Bjork: Video Killed The Radio Star

p.n: Bjork: Video Killed The Radio Star VI (7)
p.k: A fascinating look at the creative processes behind some of Bjork's most iconic music videos
Film experts reflect on the life and career of Oscar-winning actor Walter Matthau, who starred in the comedies Fortune Cookie, The Odd Couple and Grumpy Old Men
A fascinating look at the life and career of Shirley MacLaine, one of Hollywood's legendary leading ladies, who starred in films including The Apartment and Sweet Charity
Home Sweet Home The photographers return home as they are challenged to capture themselves, their families and their roots. Johnny Briggs assists them back in the studio
New. Fun In the final episode, Rankin takes a stunning action portrait of a tennis star, and is re-joined by Brett Rogers and Layton Williams to choose
76% Nations An insightful look into the Celtic nations' view of the union today, with a musical sketch show in Glasgow and a new take on the Union Jack

p.n: New: The Grapes Of Wrath: The Ghost of Modern America
p.k: New. Eye-opening film examining the scandalous, cult book by John Steinbeck. 80 years later, the themes in the novel are more current than ever
New. A celebration of literary culture, and a fascinating look at New York's rare book world. Meet its remarkable inhabitants, from writers and collectors
